intro: Ixoca trojanensis, commonly known as the Trojan ixoca, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to orange. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Due to habitat loss, Ixoca trojanensis is considered endangered and is the subject of ongoing conservation efforts.
